ground_truth: The cylinder goes on revolving, but no more voice comesâ€”only the whir of the needle on the empty record. At last, he remembers to replace the horn. Neff has just come out of Keyes' office. He walks slowly back towards the reception room entrance, then stands there looking out through the glass doors. All the employees have now left. Neff is entirely alone. He moves as if to go out, then stops rigidly as his face lights up with the excitement of a sudden idea. He turns quickly and walks on to his own office and enters. Neff walks across to his desk, lifts the telephone, and dials a number. Neff hangs up and stands beside the desk with a grim expression on his face, takes a handkerchief out, and wipes perspiration from his forehead and the palms of his hands. The gesture has a symbolic quality, as if he were trying to wipe away the murder. Over his face comes the commentary.
